text.section:
In this section, "personal information" means an individual's:
Social Security number; or
Driver's license number.
On or after June 1, 2010, a person may not include personal information in a deed or other recordable instrument intended for recording.

A person engaged to perform or charged with the duty to record a deed or other recordable instrument that contains personal information may, prior to recording:
Permanently delete the personal information from the deed or other recordable instrument; or
Request that the personal information be masked from the deed or other recordable instrument in accordance with § 8-504 of the State Government Article.

A person is immune from civil liability or criminal penalty if the person:
Inadvertently records a deed or other recordable instrument containing personal information; or
Deletes or masks personal information from a deed or other recordable instrument in accordance with subsection (c) of this section.
If a deed or other recordable instrument that contains personal information is inadvertently recorded, the inclusion of the personal information does not affect the validity of the instrument.
